info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 30 at 10:42AM CDT by NWS Quad Cities IA IL
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Quad Cities IA IL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Iowa...
Cedar River near Conesville affecting Louisa and Muscatine Counties.
Iowa River near Lone Tree affecting Johnson, Washington and Louisa Counties.
Iowa River at Wapello affecting Louisa County.
Iowa River at Oakville affecting Louisa County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Iowa River at Wapello.
* WHEN...From Thursday afternoon until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Water affects residences near the U.S. Highway 61 bridge.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 20.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow afternoon and continue rising to a crest of 24.1 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
The next statement will be issued byThursday morning at 1045 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH
